page.title: 02A Day at the Russell School
page.content: At 7:45 on Thursday 23rd May 1985 I woke up for a school day. First I got into my uniform. After which I had a wash and some breakfast. Then I checked that I had everything for school. 08:30 I was driven from Chalfont St Giles to Chorleywood Russell School. 09:30 The whistle was blown and all classes lined up to be called in. 09:05 The register was called. My first lesson was Needlework where I was being taught to hem a tray cloth. 10:40 At breaktime my friends and I went on the field. 10:55 I went to line up ready for swimming. When the coach arrived we got on it to go to Amersham to take my gold survival. 11:10 We travelled back to school and I ate my sandwiches. 12:40 I went onto the field until 13:10. For the rest of the afternoon we rehearsed for the school performance "THE MIKADO" which will be performed in July.
